text.p: - Ukraine is threatening the world with a new Chernobyl disaster, but experts say there is no real danger there.
- President Yeltsin is in touch with a limited number of people, and I am not one of them, says Russia's security supremo Alexander Lebed in an interview.
- Public curiosity in Russia was satisfied yesterday after a news conference by a leading cardiologists who gave a full accout of President Yeltsin's heart conditions.

- Russia's government decided to improve the budget situation by cutting tax and customs privileges for so-called extra budget funds formed by various ministries and enterprises to avoid tax payments.

- General Alexander Lebed is gradually turning from a real polititian into a mythological character, says the paper dedicating two pages to a profile of the general to mark his 100 days in big politics.
- There is no sensation: any president may become a patient, says the headline on the paper's front page.

- The health of Russia's president is not only a public issue but also an international one because "such a huge country as Russia should always be under control", said communist leader Gennady Zyuganov in Strasbourg.
- The diagnosis is there would be no elections, says the headline of an article on Yeltsin's health.
